title: Jesse Williams is a Fixer at Positano's 'Hotel Costiera' in Teaser Trailer
description: "It's like Neverland. It's beautiful... But it's full of sharks." Prime Video has revealed the teaser for Hotel Costiera, a new thriller crime series starring Jesse Williams set on the fanciest Mediterranean coast in Italy. It's set for release starting in September this fall streaming on Prime Video, but they're kicking off the buzz early with this teaser trailer now. Daniel De Luca, a former Marine, returns to Italy to work as a fixer at a luxury hotel in Positano on the Amalfi Coast. Shortly thereafter, the owner's daughter disappears and De Luca is tasked with finding her. Daniel must do everything he can to bring her home, but facing those who kidnapped the girl will be more challenging than any problem Daniel has ever faced. This looks like it might be entertaining enough to watch and pretend you're there. Here's the first look teaser trailer for Prime Video's series Hotel Costiera, direct from PV's YouTube: Daniel De Luca (Jesse Williams) is a half Italian former U.S. marine who returns to Italy, the land of his childhood, to start a new job as a fixer in one of the world's most luxurious hotels, located right on the spectacular coastline of Positano. Hotel Costiera is a new streaming series created and directed by filmmakers Adam Bernstein (episodes of "Divorce", "Better Call Saul", "The Sinner", "Billions", "Silo") & Giacomo Martelli (episodes of "Rosy Abate", "Blanca", "Miss Fallaci"). No finalized writers credits are available yet. It's produced by Amazon MGM Studios and Luca Bernabei for Lux Vide, a Fremantle Group company. Executive produced by Jesse Williams and others.
